summary: A small house in Riverwood built for a mage.
descriptionHtml:
[Description]
This is a small, cozy player home located right out of Riverwood. You can't miss it. It is on the side towards Whiterun. It is available from the start, but won't make the game overpowered in any way. This was built with mage accessibility in mind. It has lore friendly clutter and lots of custom storage.

[Features]
-Small Cooking Station
-Bed
-Custom Storage
-Mage themed lighting
-Lots of Clutter
-Waterfalls(I like waterfalls)
-Small Greenhouse
-Alchemy Station
-Lots of Bookcases (300+ books)
-Reading Area
-Enchanter
-Display Cases
-Interior Fully Navmeshed

[Notes]
This has lots of mage themed clutter. You will not find a smithy here(possibly in a future update). There are no mannequins. You are not a warrior! There are still a couple of spots outside where navmesh can be a little touchy, but followers can get inside.

[Installation]
NMM:
Click install with Nexus Mod Manger
Install in NMM
Make sure it is activated

Manual:
Download the file
Drag the data file into your root skyrim folder. Or open the data file in your skyrim folder and drag the esp file in.

[Uninstallation]
Remove any belongings from house
Leave the cell. Preferably go to an interior.
Deactivate in mod manager or Data Files

[Credits]
Oaristys and Tony67 for the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/16525/?]Modders Resources[/url]
me for making the mod
I used [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/15983/?]True Vision ENB[/url] for the screenshots

[To do list]
Dawnguard addons
Hearthfire Garden
Improve Navmesh
More Clutter and Decoration
author: flamingdiaper4U
